plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its large, showy flowers that bloom in late fall to early spring. The flowers have numerous petals and can be single or double.
plants.location: East Asia (native); widely cultivated in temperate regions globally
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica was named after the Jesuit botanist Georg Kamel and is highly prized in traditional Japanese gardens.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub that blooms in warm climates almost year-round, with peak flowering in late spring and again in autumn to early winter.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin; widely cultivated in subtropical and tropical regions
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic; all parts of the plant contain compounds that can be fatal if ingested.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant that produces large, white flowers often blooming in winter, including December. It thrives in shaded woodlands and gardens in temperate areas.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Christmas Rose is not a true rose and blooms in the coldest months of the year.

plants.name: Brassica oleracea var. acephala
plants.description: Flowering kale produces ornamental rosettes of colorful leaves and small yellow flowers in cool weather, often blooming into winter.
plants.funFact: Kale flowers attract pollinators even during colder months, supporting beneficial insect populations in winter gardens.
